oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter dated February 25, 1865, from B. F. McCutchen to his father
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: B. F. (Benjamin Franklin) McCutchen was a private in Company I, 6th Kentucky Mounted Infantry, C. S. A.. His health deteriorated significantly during the war, prompting him to pay for a replacement to complete his service. In this letter, McCutchen tells of his struggle with dropsy (congestive heart failure). He states, "I will not now weigh more than 115 pounds never was reduced so much in my life. As soon as I am able I am going before a medical board to ask to get a permanent discharge"
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Metro Archives, Nashville, Davidson County, Tennessee
